description: In a quiet corner of Bar 101, Sven Halek decides to leak evidence of the dormant 'reverse index' protocol to trusted activists, intending to force public confrontation with the BCI's manipulation.

Key activists publish details of the reverse index and urge immediate system action. Word spreads quickly through digital networks, causing fear and hope in equal measure as citizens anticipate major change.

Stenograd wakes to a shocking realignment: residents in previously low-scoring areas receive top-tier BCI scores, granting full privileges, while former high-scorers face restrictions and exclusion from basic services.

Protests and celebrations erupt in different districts as Council factions offer clashing explanations. Some defend the reversal as overdue justice, others warn of dangerous instability and loss of trust in the system.
Amid mounting unrest and citywide confusion, the Council convenes emergency talks. Residents and activists demand a transparent debate about the meaning of fairness and the future of BCI governance.
